security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only documentation and workflow instructions for Orval-based API client generation. No file access, network calls, or code execution capabilities detected.

content.user_title: Generate Type-Safe API Clients from OpenAPI
content.value_statement: Developers spend hours manually creating API client code and types. This skill automates API client generation from OpenAPI specifications using Orval.
actual_capabilities: Runs Orval to generate type-safe API client code
Executes TypeScript type checking on generated code
Reports generation results with file paths
limitations: Requires pre-configured Orval setup in frontend directory
Needs existing api-docs.yaml file in backend resources
Only generates clients, does not modify or create API specifications

faq.question: What tools are compatible with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It generates TypeScript clients for any frontend framework.

faq.question: What are the limits on OpenAPI spec size?
faq.answer: Orval can handle large specifications. Very large specs may take longer to generate and increase bundle size.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my build process?
faq.answer: Add the generation command to your package.json scripts. Run it before development or as part of your CI pipeline.

faq.question: Is my data safe during generation?
faq.answer: Yes. Orval runs locally and only reads the OpenAPI spec file. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Generation failed with type errors. What should I do?
faq.answer: Check that your OpenAPI spec is valid. Ensure backend and frontend TypeScript configurations are compatible.

faq.question: How is this different from Swagger Codegen?
faq.answer: Orval generates specifically for TypeScript and React applications with better type inference and hooks support.
